questions.question: Diane and Ben are both pushing a cart in the same direction. Diane with 43N and Ben with 32N.  What is the net force?
Ben pulls the cart with a force of 30N. Diane pushes in the opposite direction with 43N. What is the net force?
A, B, C, and D are dogsled racing. Use the equations for Newton’s 2nd law, who would win if each dog pulls with 50N.

choices.answer: A has 8 dogs and a sled with a total mass of 500 kg.
B has 6 dogs and a sled with a total mass of 400 kg.
C has 7 dogs and a sled with a total mass of 550 kg.
D has 10 dogs and a sled with a total mass of 600 kg.

questions.question: For forces acting in the same direction, the net force on an object is found by:
For forces acting in opposite directions, the net force is found by:
The difference between balanced and unbalanced forces is that:

choices.answer: balanced forces are multiples of 5 N, while unbalanced forces are not.
balanced forces have net force =  0 N, while unbalanced forces do not.
balanced forces = net force unequal to 0 N, while unbalanced forces = 0N.
balanced forces have many forces that = same number...unbalanced doesn't.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of Newton’s first law of motion?

choices.answer: An object at rest stays at rest.
An object in motion stays in motion.
Object in motion has constant velocity unless acted on by a balanced force.
An object in motion stays in motion unless acted on by an unbalance force.

questions.question: The net force on an object that is at rest:

choices.answer: changes depending on the location of the object.
is the result of unbalanced forces acting on the object.
depends on the balanced forces acting on the object.

questions.question: Newton’s second law of motion states that an object’s acceleration is equal to:

choices.answer: the net force on an object divided by its mass.
the mass of an object divided by its net force.
the net force of an object divided by its speed.
the speed of an object divided by its net force.

questions.question: Friction is a force that works _____________ of an object’s motion.
